result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark James Fossell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowling Violating A Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Remaining balance shall be returned to the surety.
-Restitution is set at zero.

On 6/7/2022:  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunition or body armor.  Court advised defendant tht his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA  sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Obtain mental health assessment and any recommended treatment.
Complete an anger management class.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens and mandtory breath tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark James Fossell

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief - received
Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing statements by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE with COUNT 2, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to 113 DAYS, with credit for 113 DAYS time served.

As to COUNT 1: This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS.
Condition of Probation:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens and mandatory breath tests
Obtain Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment
No contact with JAF
Complete an Anger management class
Provide DNA sample
Resitution is set at Zero.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. Remaining balance shall be returned to the surety.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody for sentencing.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Supplements, Filed.
Letter to Court, Filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Arguments heard by state and defense. For reasons stated on the record, Court takes no action on bail. All conditions remain the same. Discovery and global offer received. Defense requests more time to review offer with client. 5/27 scheduling conference remains set.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.
E-mailed parties to set up immediate bail review date. Defendant at HOC. Zoom appearance arranged with HOC by the clerk.
Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 05-09-2022.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense advises he has not receiced discovery and requests a scheduling date.  Defendant to be in person on the next date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail received and filed.  bm
